required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of BRM421 for Dry Eye Syndrome Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double Masked, Placebo Controlled Clinical Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of BRM421 Ophthalmic Solution in Subjects With Dry Eye Using a Controlled Adverse Environment (CAE®) Model

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of BRM421 Ophthalmic Solution to placebo for the treatment of the signs and symptoms of dry eye.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-center, double-masked, randomized, placebo-controlled, phase 2/3 study with approximately 200 subjects. (around 100 subjects per treatment arm).

primary_outcome.description: Corneal staining was performed to grade the degree of corneal epithelial cell injury as measured by fluorescence using slit-lamp examination. The staining was graded with the Ophthalmic Research Associates, Inc. (ORA) scale. The corneal surface is divided into three regions: superior, central and inferior. The scores for each of these 3 regions ranged from 0 to 4 (0=no staining/none; 1=occasional/trace; 2=countable/mild; 3=uncountable, but not confluent/moderate; 4=confluent/severe) with 0.5 point increments, and lower score indicates a better outcome.
Eye dryness score was scored on a Ora Calibra® Ocular Discomfort & 4-Symptom Questionnaire ranges from 0-5 (0=None; 5=Worst).

secondary_outcome.description: The OSDI is a 12-question validated questionnaire used to measure ocular symptoms, visual function, and environmental factors that may affect a patient's vision. The OSDI scoring scale ranges from 0 to 100. The lower the score, the more symptomatic relief from dry eye symptoms a patient experiences. Baseline-adjusted scores were tabulated; a negative number change from baseline indicates a perceived improvement in ocular comfort.

arm_group.description: A topical solution of BRIM421 ophthalmic drops

intervention.description: The active control with BRM421 solution
